title: Adjustments of Certain Rates of Pay

enrichment.summary: This executive order updates and sets the pay rates for various federal employees, including civilians, senior executives, judges, military personnel, and administrative law judges. It establishes the new salary schedules and locality-based pay adjustments effective in early 2013 and supersedes a previous executive order on the same topic.
potential_concerns: Adjustments in pay rates may create disparities or perceived inequities among federal employee groups, including veterans and active-duty military personnel, potentially impacting workforce morale.
Locality-based comparability payments could lead to increased budgetary pressures in high-cost regions, possibly affecting federal workforce hiring or retention strategies.
Updates to Veterans Health Administration pay scales might strain VA healthcare budgets, potentially affecting service quality or availability for veterans.
Raising pay for senior executives and administrative law judges may lead to scrutiny regarding federal spending priorities amid broader budget constraints.
Changes in military personnel pay could have implications for military readiness and force structure if not balanced with overall defense budget considerations.
